title: Customized Online Science Concept Education for Visually Impaired Adolescents

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific terminology and ability to use online learning tools
context.additional_context: A process for visually impaired students to learn science concepts (e.g., material structure) online to understand vocational social studies content. Requires multisensory instructional materials tailored to individual disabilities.

learning_goals: Students can explain the basic structure of matter with over 80% accuracy through tactile graphics and audio descriptions.
Learners can analyze intermolecular interactions with a success rate of over 75% using 3D-printed models and braille worksheets.
Students demonstrate conceptual application skills by scoring 70 or above on weekly quizzes (10 items) and final comprehensive assessments (20 items).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
